hints.content: Start by understanding what a pangram is. A pangram is a sentence that includes every letter of the English alphabet at least once. Can you list all the letters in the English alphabet?
Consider how you can track which letters have appeared in the sentence. You might want to use a data structure that allows you to store unique letters. What data structures can help you with this?
Think about how you will iterate through the sentence. You can loop through each character in the string. What will you do when you encounter a letter that you haven't seen before?
Remember that the English alphabet consists of 26 letters. After processing the sentence, how will you check if you have seen all 26 letters?
You might want to use a set to store the letters you encounter. Sets automatically handle uniqueness for you. How would you add letters to a set as you iterate through the sentence?
As you add letters to your set, keep track of the total count of unique letters. Once you finish processing the sentence, how will you compare this count to 26?
Consider edge cases, such as very short sentences. What is the minimum length of a sentence that can still be a pangram? How will you handle sentences that are shorter than 26 characters?

Think about the return value of your function. You need to return true if the sentence is a pangram and false otherwise. How will you structure your return statement based on the count of unique letters?
Make sure to account for all letters in the alphabet. If your set contains less than 26 letters after processing the sentence, what will you return?
Now, put together all the parts: iterate through the sentence, add letters to a set, check the size of the set, and return the appropriate boolean value. What does your final function look like?

questionNotes: A pangram must include every letter from 'a' to 'z'.
The input sentence will only contain lowercase letters.
The length of the sentence will be between 1 and 1000 characters.
Return true if the sentence is a pangram, otherwise return false.
